data.title: Awsome food and service
data.text: Great lunch, dinner place.Very good food with lots of to choose from.Smiling and ready to help you service. Very reasonable prices. I would definitely come back!

data.title: Great lunchWill be back for more
data.text:
Delightful find with great lunch special including fresh side salads
Not the usual iceberg but nice lettuce and sides of smokey babaghanoush and buckwheat pilaf
Pleasant ,nice fresh
Would be great takeout
Great competition to well known local place for middle eastern good

data.title: Cheap but tasteless lunch special
data.text:
I had the lunch special at $5.99 which included chicken shwarma, 3 side choices, a rice choice, and a pita.   The chicken was dry and literally lacking any flavor whatsoever.
The sides were somewhat better - baba ghanous, taboule, and a tomato-eggplant - but they would be considered average at best.    Mrs had the felafel plate.    Felafel was cold, dry and also tasteless.    Cant imagine coming back here.

data.title: delicious, healthy, reasonably-priced food
data.text:
This small restaurant has one large and 18 small tables, which can be rearranged to accommodate the size of your group.  Go to your left as you enter and grab a paper menu --  or walk ahead to the Chipotle-type counter and read the wall menu -- or ask the friendly person behind the counter to explain your choices.

They are extensive.

The lunch special (Monday - Friday, 11:00 - 3:00) is an amazing bargain!

The pilafs are your base:  choose from Armenian, mushroom, kasha, rice lentil or roasted potato.
Add protein -- choose from chicken, beef, tilapia, falafel.
Add salads -- choose from cabbage, onion-sumac, taboula, green, hummus, baba ghanouge, homov (sauteed eggplant, peppers, tomato, onions), red beans, cucumber-yougurt.
They add a piece of home-made bread and you're ready to go.
The garlic sauce is extra and worth it.

In future we plan to try their pizza, fattaeir and b'ajean.

There is some street parking and there is a parking lot on the east side of the building.

Go to the website and print a coupon for 10% off an order of $25 or more.

Everything I've tasted here has been outstanding.  I am planning to go back asap to try both versions of their vegetarian lentil soup.

data.title: Fresh Awesome Food!
data.text: We love the combo platter! It is absolutely delicious. The food is fresh, healthy and tasty. You really must try it! It is simply one of our favorite places to eat. The prices are very reasonable and it is served cafeteria style.

data.title: Outstanding Armenian Delight!
data.text: This hole in the wall place has FANTASTIC, fresh, homemade food. The ambiance is nothing special, but it is worth the trip. The portions are generous and we licked our plates clean the food was so delicious. I highly recommend this place.

data.title: Deliciously different food at a good price
data.text: Deliciously different. Though the menu is varied, I generally only buy the lunch special ($5.50) but this still leaves me many options. There are several components of the special you get to pick between. Choose from rice pilaf, kasha or potato as a base under the chicken, steak, lamb AND falafel that come with the special. Then pick from slaw or salad and from a variety of additional sides and sauces. If you are lucky enough to get the older gentleman preparing your order, you'll be impressed with the time and artistry he puts into even a small side of hummus, or the number of sauces and seasonings he puts into a falafel wrap. (Speaking of wrap, I highly recommend asking them to swap out the default home made bread that comes with each order for a warm piece of wrap. Much tastier in my opinion.) Be prepared to try something new. Better yet, go with a friend, order a variety and sample from each other's plates. Even for the dishes that share a name with middle eastern food, it don't taste quite the same, but just as good. It doesn't help that the food isn't labelled and the preparer's English is not so good. As much as that sort of thing normally bothers me, I've yet to be disappointed by the food. Not as great a value as the lunch specials were before the remodeling, but in the months since re-opening, they've made some adjustments to the prices and returned to the original recipes, making Niu still a great deal for a very tasty and filling lunch. Worth a trip to Skokie, even if you're a jaded Chicago foodie, just to give it a try.

data.title: Fresh, flavorful, great value
data.text:
Rarely do I find a restaurant that serves healthy, great tasting food at a competitive price. NIU Armenian Grill is just one of those restaurants. In this space used to be another Armenian restaurant that moved to Glenview. The manager decided to go off on his own, so he purchased the Skokie restaurant and started his own shop.

The downside is that the ordering process is a little confusing. He's trying to improve on making it easier to understand what the options are and how much the cost. 

The plus side is that the food is wonderful and cheap. You pick a meat (Chicken, beef, lamb), a carbohydrate (rice pilaf, roasted potatoes, couscous) and three or four salads (cabbage salad, humos, baba ganoush, bean salad, and others). 

It is the kind of place where you order upfront, then sit down with the food. They provide real silverware, nice touch for a restaurant that charges less than $10 per plate.

We've now been there several times, it has become one of our mainstays.
